DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate whether transcranial direct current stimulation ( tDCS ) enhance efficacy cognitive behavioural therapy treatment depression .
DOC.brief_title: Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation ( tDCS ) Adjunct Cognitive Behaviour Therapy ( CBT )
DOC.criteria: 1 . Participants ≥ 18 year old . 2 . Have DSMIV diagnosis Major Depressive Episode minimum 4 week duration . 3 . MADRS score ≥ 20 study entry . 1 . Participant unable give inform consent . 2 . DSMIV diagnosis psychotic disorder ( lifetime ) . 3 . Bipolar disorder diagnosis mood stabiliser . 4 . Eating disorder ( current within past year ) . 5 . Obsessive compulsive disorder ( lifetime ) . 6 . Posttraumatic stress disorder ( current within past year ) . 7 . Mental retardation . 8 . Drug alcohol abuse dependence ( precede 3 month ) . 9 . Inadequate response ECT ( current episode depression ) . 10 . Rapid clinical response require , e.g. , high suicide risk , inanition psychosis . 11 . Clinically defined neurological disorder insult . 12 . Metal cranium , skull defect , skin lesion scalp ( cut , abrasion , rash ) propose electrode site . 13 . Pregnancy . 14 . Concurrent long act benzodiazepine , ritalin dexamphetamine medication . 15 . Change psychotropic medication 2week period prior study course 3week trial . 16 . Participant become hypomanic manic , define DSMIV .
